verses.verse: How beautiful <WH3302> are thy feet <WH6471> in sandals <WH5275>, O prince <WH5081>'s daughter <WH1323>! Thy rounded <WH2542> thighs <WH3409> are like jewels <WH2481>, The work <WH4639> of the hands <WH3027> of a skilful workman <WH542>.

Thy body <WH8326> is like a round <WH5469> goblet <WH101>, Wherein no mingled <WH2637> wine <WH4197> is wanting <WH990>: Thy waist is like a heap <WH6194> of wheat <WH2406> Set about <WH5473> with lilies <WH7799>.
Thy two <WH8147> breasts <WH7699> are like two8147, Joshua82 fawns <WH6646> That are twins of a roe <WH8380>.

Thy neck <WH6677> is like the tower <WH4026> of ivory <WH8127>; Thine eyes <WH5869> as the pools <WH1295> in Heshbon <WH2809>, By the gate <WH8179> of Bath-rabbim <WH1337>; Thy nose <WH639> is like the tower <WH4026> of Lebanon <WH3844> Which looketh <WH6822> toward <WH6440> Damascus <WH1834>.
Thy head <WH7218> upon thee is like Carmel <WH3760>, And the hair <WH1803> of thy head <WH7218> like purple <WH713>; The king <WH4428> is held <WH631> captive in the tresses thereof <WH7298>.
How fair <WH3302> and how pleasant <WH5276> art thou <WH160>, O love, for delights <WH8588>!
This thy stature <WH6967> is like <WH1819> to a palm-tree <WH8558>, And thy breasts <WH7699> to its clusters <WH811>.

I said <WH559>, I will climb up <WH5927> into the palm-tree <WH8558>, I will take hold <WH270> of the branches <WH5577> thereof <WH7699>: Let thy breasts be as clusters <WH811> of the vine <WH1612>, And the smell <WH7381> of thy breath <WH639> like apples <WH8598>,

And thy mouth <WH2441> like the best <WH2896> wine <WH3196>, That goeth <WH1980> down smoothly <WH4339> for my beloved <WH1730>, Gliding <WH1680> through the lips <WH8193> of those that are asleep <WH3463>.
I am my beloved <WH1730>'s; And his desire is toward me <WH8669>.
Come <WH3212>, my beloved <WH1730>, let us go forth <WH3318> into the field <WH7704>; Let us lodge <WH3885> in the villages <WH3723>.

Let us get up early <WH7925> to the vineyards <WH3754>; Let us see <WH7200> whether the vine <WH1612> hath budded <WH6524>, And its blossom <WH6524> is open <WH6605>, And the pomegranates <WH7416> are in flower <WH5132>: There will I give <WH5414> thee my love <WH1730>.

The mandrakes <WH1736> give <WH5414> forth fragrance <WH7381>; And at our doors <WH6607> are all manner of precious <WH4022> fruits <WH2319>, new and old <WH3465>, Which I have laid up <WH6845> for thee <WH1730>, O my beloved.
